article.headline: Ark.-Little Rock 59, Rice 52
article.story: HOUSTON (AP) -- De'Andre Eggins scored a team-high 12 points and Arkansas-Little Rock beat cold-shooting Rice 59-52 on Tuesday night. Rice remained winless on the season with its fourth loss. The Owls went 8-of-22 from the field in the first half and shot 41 percent for the game. The Trojans shot 42 percent for the game. Steven Moore added 11 points off the bench for Arkansas-Little Rock (5-1) and Mike Smith had 10. The Trojans led 27-23 at the break. Jasen Williams and Cory Pflieger both scored 13 points to lead Rice, while Paulius Packevicius had a game-high 10 rebounds. Arkansas-Little Rock converted 17 Rice turnovers into 13 points, while Rice (0-4) managed only seven points off the Trojans' 20 turnovers.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
